articles.title: Spokesman for DPRK Foreign Ministry on Korean Americans' Reunion with Separated Family Members and Relatives
articles.content:
Spokesman for DPRK Foreign Ministry on Korean Americans' Reunion with Separated Family Members and Relatives
						

					Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Foreign Ministry of the DPRK on Thursday gave the following answer to question put by KCNA as regards the issue of reunion of Korean Americans with their separated families and relatives:
					
					Recently the U.S. side proposed the DPRK to discuss the issue of the above-said reunion through the U.S. Red Cross Society and various official channels. 
					
					The DPRK Red Cross Society is positively examining the issue from a humanitarian view-point though hostile relations exist between the DPRK and the U.S.
					
					If both sides promote cooperation, beginning with such humanitarian issues, it will help build mutual confidence required for solving complicated problems in the future.

articles.title: DPRK Delegation Leaves for Mongolia
articles.content:
DPRK Delegation Leaves for Mongolia
						

					Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the State General Bureau of Tourism of the DPRK headed by its General Director Kim To Jun left Pyongyang on Thursday to visit Mongolia.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Sends Birthday Spread to Centenarian
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Sends Birthday Spread to Centenarian
						

					Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il sent a birthday spread to centenarian Kim Ok Bi, resident in Neighborhood Unit 73 in Mangum-dong, Sariwon City, North Hwanghae Province. 
					
					Born as a daughter of a tenant farmer in Unryul County, South Hwanghae Province, she has led a worthwhile life since President Kim Il Sung liberated the country. 
					
					She devoted herself to farm work for the sake of the benevolent socialist system. She brought up all her sons and daughters to be good members of the society. 
					
					She leads a well-regulated life, free from an unbalanced diet.

articles.title: Vol. 10 of "Selected Works of Kim Jong Il" (Enlarged Edition) Published
articles.content:
Vol. 10 of "Selected Works of Kim Jong Il" (Enlarged Edition) Published
						

					Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- The Workers' Party of Korea Publishing House brought out Vol. 10 of "Selected Works of Kim Jong Il" (enlarged edition) which comprehensively deals with immortal classic works of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					The book contains 36 works including speeches, talks, papers and letters he authored from April, 1982 to July, 1984.
					
					The works deal with the glorious path of struggle covered by the WPK and indicate the tasks for accomplishing the cause of modeling the whole society on the Juche idea.
					
					They set forth important tasks for improving the standard of people's living, the supreme principle governing the WPK's activities, and dynamically accelerating the socialist economic construction.
					
					They also indicate ways for tapping all latent reserves in all fields of national economy and strictly abiding by discipline in planning and the socialist principle of distribution.
					
					The book also contains works indicating tasks before mass media and the field of education and clarifying principled issues arising in establishing revolutionary law-abiding habit throughout the society.
					
					There are in the book works indicating ways for bringing about a revolutionary surge in creating literature and art works and popularizing literary and art activities. It also contains works giving answers to theoretical and practical issues arising in speeding up the revolution and construction as required by the developing reality including the need for the officials to wage a positive struggle for national reunification with conviction and optimism.

articles.title: Guidelines for Land Management
articles.content:
Guidelines for Land Management
						

					Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il published the work "On Bringing About a Fresh Turn in Land Management" on August 11, Juche 85 (1996).
					
					In the work the leader set forth tasks to bring about a fresh turn in land management and indicated ways of carrying out the tasks. 
					
					Since the publication of the work, a nationwide campaign for land management has been conducted successfully in the country. 
					
					Cities and county seats have been face-lifted as required by a new century. Hundreds of thousands of hectares have been turned into standardized fields and the Kaechon-Lake Thaesong Waterway and the Paekma-Cholsan Waterway built. 
					
					Hundreds of thousands of modern dwelling houses were built in rural communities and over 1 500 000 hectares of forests created throughout the country. Many roads have been constructed or reconstructed and rivers improved.

articles.title: U.S. Is Very One Aggravating Tension and Breaking Peace
articles.content:
U.S. Responsible for Tension in Korea
						

					Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- The United States plans to wage a military exercise, Ulji Freedom Guardian, with south Korea from August 16.
					
					More than 30 000 U.S. troops and huge south Korean forces will take part in the exercise.
					
					The annual drill drawing sophisticated weapons and even civilians is a nuclear war training against the DPRK.
					
					With countries concerned moving for dialogue and cooperation over the Korean Peninsula, the exercise will hurt the atmosphere of dialogue and aggravate the situation of the region.
					
					It will also increase the danger of war in the Korean peninsula.
					
					Whenever an atmosphere of peace comes to the peninsula, the U.S. has used to bring the situation to the brink of war. 
					
					The U.S. intentionally strains the situation of the peninsula, going against the people's desire for dialogue and peace. 
					
					The Korean people love peace, but they will never allow others to bring the danger of war to the peninsula through military exercise.
					
					The U.S. and the south Korean authorities should cancel the plan, deeply aware of the steadfast will of the DPRK army and people to strongly react to the exercise.

articles.title: Minju Joson Urges S. Korean Authorities to Drop Idea of Hurting Fellow Countrymen
articles.content:
Minju Joson Urges S. Korean Authorities to Drop Idea of Hurting Fellow Countrymen
						

					Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- If the south Korean authorities truly stand for the improvement of the north-south relations, they should drop the wicked attempt to do harm to the fellow countrymen with the help of outsiders.
					
					Minju Joson Thursday says this in a bylined commentary.
					
					The news analyst goes on:
					
					They are spreading rumors that they would take steps to improve the relations with the DPRK with August 15 as an occasion. But they only seek to hurt the fellow countrymen in collusion with outside forces.
					
					The appendix to "CONPLAN 5029" the south Korean and the U.S. warmongers have worked out from two years ago is clear evidence of it.
					
					The said document which was acquired and made public by south Korean media included a phrase that in case of "emergency", the U.S. would play a key role with the south Korean authorities' permission. This is an unpardonable crime mocking and insulting the Koreans in their efforts to improve the inter-Korean relations and achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of the country.
					
					Gravity of the situation lies in that the south Korean chief executive admonished his lackeys to be careful not to cause any trouble over this document. 
					
					According to his instructions, the south Korean warmongers worked out the appendix to "CONPLAN 5029" in secrecy together with the U.S. military and applied it to the DPRK-targeted war exercises.
					
					Far from making repentance of having deliberately deteriorated the north-south relations since taking office, the south Korean conservative authorities are escalating the confrontation with compatriots, while going against the trend of the times. This would never help improve the inter-Korean relations but aggravate the situation on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					Not words but practical actions would prove exactly what they want--improved relations or escalated confrontation.

articles.title: Provokers Will Face Harsh Punishment
articles.content:
Provokers Will Face Harsh Punishment
						

					Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- The south Korean military Wednesday fabricated a shelling incident near Yonphyong Island and is now trying to blame the DPRK for it.
					
					The fabrication is touching off indignation among the Korean people.
					
					Kim Pok Man, a department director of the Ministry of Light Industry, told KCNA: 
					
					I am indignant at the military provocation near Yonphyong Island like last year's.
					
					Tideland reclamation is now going on around Ryongmae Islet in South Hwanghae Province, opposite to Yonphyong Island.
					
					Since the project has been already known by media, the south side must know that frequent bursting sounds from around Ryongmae Islet are blasting sounds.
					
					But they fired shells towards the north, alleging that a blasting was a shelling. 
					
					The incident was apparently motivated by their ill-intentioned bid to chill the atmosphere of dialogue maturing in and around the Korean peninsula and impede the improvement of north-south relations.
					
					The criminal intention deserves denunciation from all the Koreans and international community.
					
					They should clearly understand the might of the Korean army and civilians, closely rallied around leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					We would push ahead with the tideland reclamation, regardless of their reckless moves.
					
					A worker of the Pyongyang Automation Instrument Factory, Jon Mun Chol, said:
					
					The south Korean military is alleging that the north asserts itself over the incident. But the allegation is nothing but a foolish attempt to cover up the truth of the incident.
					
					They kicked up another anti-DPRK row without confirming what happened, though up-to-date monitoring devices are apparently available for them.
					
					What they really seek is to incite an atmosphere of confrontation with the north through faked-up "spying case" and "assassination plot" in south Korea, justify the Ulji Freedom Guardian joint military exercise and make an excuse to start a war against the north.
					
					The fact clearly shows that with the south Korean bellicose forces left intact, it is hard to expect improved relations between the north and the south and any progress in the peace and denuclearization process of the Korean peninsula.
					
					If they persistently seek confrontation and war against the north, they will not escape from a stern punishment by the nation.
					
					The U.S. is also responsible for the incident as it has egged the south Korean military on to reckless military provocations against the DPRK, while frequently staging joint military exercises with south Korea under the war scenario "CONPLAN 5029".
					
					If the U.S. does not want to see the situation getting worse, it should immediately cancel the planned Ulji Freedom Guardian to show the international community its sincerity concerning dialogue and peace.

articles.title: KCNA Terms Japan's "White Paper on Defense" Document for Aggression
articles.content:
KCNA Terms Japan's "White Paper on Defense" Document for Aggression
						

					Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) --The Japanese reactionaries in the "white paper on defense" for 2011 released recently expressed "concern" about nukes and missiles of the DPRK, talking about their issues.
					
					This is another unpardonable provocation to the DPRK as it is revelation of their persistent hostility towards it. 
					
					The DPRK's bolstering of its defence capability is entirely aimed at protecting its sovereignty, security and territorial integrity. Its nukes and missiles, therefore, can never be threats to Japan.
					
					This notwithstanding, the Japanese reactionaries again pulled up the DPRK over the nuclear and missile issues pertaining to its right to self-defence. Lurking behind this is their wild ambition to cover up the true colors of their nuclear issue and the moves to establish the missile defense system in the eyes of the international community under its pretence and push forward the scenario for turning Japan into a military giant behind the scene and thus trump up an excuse for staging a comeback to Korea and the rest of Northeast Asia. 
					
					As widely known to the world, Japan had already researched and developed nuclear technology and facilities and has a stockpile of plutonium enough to produce thousands of nukes. It is stepping up the moves to establish the MD with the U.S. in real earnest to launch preemptive nuclear attack.
					
					The Japan "Self-Defense Forces" have emerged forces for aggression. Institutional, spiritual and material preparations have been rounded off to start reinvasion of Asia. 
					
					What remains to be done by Japan at present is just to create an opportunity for reinvasion. 
					
					To this end, the Japanese reactionaries vociferously claim that territories of neighboring countries belong to their territory without any ground, while noisily advocating the theory of "threats" to them.
					
					It is part of this campaign that in the 2011 white paper they described Tok Islets, part of the inviolable territory of Korea, as Japan's territory and vociferated about "maritime threat" from China.
					
					Reality goes to clearly prove that the white paper is nothing but a document for aggression and war as it is designed to realize their ambition for reinvasion to all intents and purposes. 
					
					It is absurd and preposterous for the war criminal Japan to release hundreds of page-long war document every year, far from redeeming its past crimes committed against Korea and other neighboring countries. 
					
					Japan has become the root cause of rendering the situation in Northeast Asia unstable and threatening and disturbing its peace and security. 
					
					The regional situation gets tenser and the danger of war increases due to Japan's moves to grab others' territories and launch reinvasion. The peaceful development of the neighboring countries is, consequently, jeopardized. 
					
					The Japanese reactionaries should halt their futile actions, cogitating about the grave consequences to be entailed by the above-said reckless moves. 
					
					The Japanese militarists are fated to meet only a miserable end as they are obsessed with the ambition for territorial expansion and reinvasion.

articles.title: Japan's False Report about DPRK Rebuked
articles.content:
Japan's False Report about DPRK Rebuked
						

					Beijing, August 10 (KCNA) -- Tokyo Shimbun and other Japanese media Sunday reported that the DPRK asked China to hold joint military exercises only to be snubbed.
					
					South Korean media, including Dong-A Ilbo, echoed this report.
					
					In an interview with the Chinese newspaper Global Times Tuesday, the Press Department of the Defense Ministry of China stated that "there was not such a thing as reported". 
					
					The paper Wednesday quoted a Chinese expert in the Korean affairs, Lu Chao, as saying that China must express resentment against Japan's false report.
					
					It was not the first time that Japan released false reports, straining the tensions in Northeast Asia. 
					
					Earlier, Japanese media lied that soldiers of the Chinese People's Liberation Army were stationed in the DPRK. 
					
					Japan is leaving no stone unturned to screw up the tensions in Northeast Asia in which some changes are under way. In this way it seeks to tighten military alliance with the U.S. and, at the same time, secure a pretext for it. 
					
					It is nothing surprising for Japan to release false reports for this purpose.

articles.title: Tank-hunting Team Movement Initiated by Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Tank-hunting Team Movement Initiated by Kim Il Sung
						

					Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- The tank-hunting team movement, which was initiated by President Kim Il Sung in the Fatherland Liberation War (June 25, 1950-July 27, 1953) was a unique military tactics greatly conducive to overpowering the enemy.
					
					One January day in Juche 40 (1951), Kim Il Sung told commanding officers of the Korean People's Army that, since the eastern front was packed with steep mountains and the western front covered with swampy land, the enemy's tanks had no other choice but to take roads. He then suggested organizing tank-hunting teams in all military units. 
					
					In August that year, he issued an order of the KPA Supreme Commander "On Organizing and Training Tank-hunting Teams".
					
					In response to the order, many tank-hunting teams were organized in the army.
					
					One of the teams destroyed 29 tanks with grenades and mines in a month.

articles.title: Dictatorial Personnel Measure in S. Korea under Fire
articles.content:
Dictatorial Personnel Measure in S. Korea under Fire
						

					Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- A deputy spokesman of the south Korean Democratic Labor Party released a commentary on August 8, urging the present chief executive to withdraw the dictatorial personnel measure.
					
					The commentary referred to a confirmation hearing for Kwon Jae Jin who was newly nominated as minister of Justice the same day.
					
					It is the worst personnel measure that the present chief executive nominated his close confidant as minister of Justice whose mission is to oversee fair law enforcement, it deplored.
					
					It was disclosed at the hearing that the Office of Chief for Civil Administration of Chongwadae, where Kwon was a member, was behind the inspection of civilians that sparked off public furor.
					
					If Kwon holds the post of Justice minister, it would not be possible to hope for correct law enforcement nor would it be possible to expect fair elections for "National Assemblymen" and "president" due next year, it noted.
					
					The commentary urged the immediate retraction of Kwon's nomination to the ministerial post, fearing that it may spark off political uneasiness.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Work Posted on Swiss Internet Homepage
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Work Posted on Swiss Internet Homepage
						

					Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- The Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea posted on its Internet homepage the full text of President Kim Il Sung's work "Let Us Achieve the Great Unity of Our Nation" on August 4.
					
					The work, published on August 1, Juche 80 (1991), clarifies the idea that the Korean nation is responsible for the country's reunification and indicates tasks for achieving the great unity of the entire nation and ways to do so.

articles.title: Korean People's Cause for Reunification Supported
articles.content:
Korean People's Cause for Reunification Supported
						

					Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- Banou Keita, chairman of the Guinea-Korea Friendship Association, released a statement on August 4 on the 14th anniversary of the publication of leader Kim Jong Il's work "Let Us Carry Out the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung's Instructions for National Reunification".
					
					The statement said that Kim Jong Il provided the Korean people with the correct guidelines for reunification by formulating as the three charters for Korea's reunification the three principles of national reunification, the 10-point programme of the great unity of the whole nation and the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo.
					
					The three charters for Korea's reunification clearly indicate the fundamental principles and ways of achieving reunification. So, they grasped the hearts of the broad Korean people and encouraged them to carrying out the cause of reunification, the statement said, adding:
					
					The charters have evoked great sympathy from the progressive people in the world for their validity and vitality.
					
					We strongly demand the south Korean authorities stop the anti-reunification and confrontation moves against the fellow countrymen as early as possible, improve the inter-Korean relations and opt for implementing the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration.
					
					Convinced that a thriving reunified nation would be built without fail on the Korean Peninsula as there are the three charters for national reunification, we extend full support and solidarity to the Korean people in their efforts to realize peaceful reunification of the country under the banner of national independence.

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Work Observed
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Work Observed
						

					Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- Lectures took place in Indonesia on August 3 and 5 on the 14th anniversary of the publication of leader Kim Jong Il's work "Let Us Carry Out the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung's Instructions for National Reunification".
					
					The lectures introduced the details of the work and its significance.
					
					The three charters for national reunification formulated by Kim Jong Il serve as the most realistic and just proposal for putting an end to Korea's division and realizing its independent and peaceful reunification, said the director of the P. T. Dwi Mitra Perkasa Company, fully supporting them and wishing for the earlier reunification of Korea.
					
					The director of an Indonesian company noted:
					
					The three charters for national reunification are guidelines for Korea's reunification. It is recognized in the world that the army of General Kim Jong Il and the DPRK are strong. I am firmly convinced of Korea's reunification.

articles.title: DPRK's Songun Politics Supported by Mexican Political Party Leader
articles.content:
DPRK's Songun Politics Supported by Mexican Political Party Leader
						

					Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- Cuautemoc Amezcua Dromundo, chairman of the Central Committee of the Socialist Popular Party of Mexico, released a statement on August 5 to mark the 51st anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of Songun revolutionary leadership.
					
					Kim Jong Il started his Songun revolutionary leadership through his inspection of Seoul Ryu Kyong Su 105 Guards Tank Division of the Korean People's Army on August 25, 1960, the statement said.
					
					He has developed in depth the Songun idea, pursuing the Songun politics for the first time in the world political history, it noted. 
					
					The Songun politics serves as the most powerful political mode guaranteeing the victorious advance of socialism and independence from the ever more undisguised war moves and interference of the imperialists and their high-handed and arbitrary practices, it stressed.
					
					The statement said that Kim Jong Il has glorified the independent dignity of the Korean people with his Songun leadership and laid a solid groundwork for the reunification of the country. It noted with appreciation that thanks to his Songun leadership the DPRK is enjoying ever-growing international position and authority.

articles.title: Application of Tuition-free Program to Students of Korean Schools in Japan Demanded
articles.content:
Application of Tuition-free Program to Students of Korean Schools in Japan Demanded
						

					Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- Nam Ju Hyon, representative of the Liaison Council of Mothers' Societies of Korean Schools, and members of Mothers' Society of Korean Junior High Schools in Tokyo and Kanagawa Prefecture Thursday visited the Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology of Japan. They called for the immediate and equal application of the tuition waiver program for senior high schools to the students of Korean schools.
					
					They expressed their resentment against the Japanese authorities for having not yet included the Korean schools only in the program, faulting with the contents of education.
					
					The Japanese citizens as well as the Koreans in Japan have waged actions for the immediate application of the program to the Korean schools, they said, and went on:
					
					This measure taken by the Japanese government against the Korean residents reminds one of the maltreatment in the period of the Japanese imperialists' rule.
					
					We can no longer tolerate the continuous persecution of the students of Korean schools, they said, vowing to continue struggle until the discrimination policy toward the Korean schools is withdrawn. 
					
					They handed a letter of request to the prime minister and the minister of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology.

articles.title: Senegalese Newspaper Introduces Three Charters for National Reunification
articles.content:
Senegalese Newspaper Introduces Three Charters for National Reunification
						

					Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- A newspaper of Senegal on August 2 carried an article titled "Great Programme of Korea's Reunification" to introduce the three charters for national reunification.
					
					The paper introduced the essence, contents and validity of the three principles of national reunification, the 10-point programme of the great unity of the whole nation and the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo which constitute the three charters for national reunification.
					
					The three charters serve as banner of inspiration for the Korean people as they arouse the broad Koreans to the sacred cause of reunification, grasping their hearts, it said.
					
					The June 15 joint declaration was adopted between the north and the south of Korea and a new era advancing toward independence and peaceful reunification opened in June 2000. It would be unthinkable without the charters, the paper noted. The present south Korean authorities have persistently turned away from such reasonable proposals for Korea's reunification, it added.
					
					If they truly hope for the reunification of the Korean Peninsula, they should respond to the reunification proposal by federal formula, the paper urged.

articles.title: Many Kindergartens to Be Constructed in China
articles.content:
Many Kindergartens to Be Constructed in China
						

					Beijing, August 10 (KCNA) -- Many public kindergartens will be built in Anhui Province, China, in three years.
					
					The province plans to build 450 new kindergartens and rebuild 278 this year.

articles.title: CPC Readers Published in China
articles.content:
CPC Readers Published in China
						

					Beijing, August 10 (KCNA) -- Concise reading books on the basic knowledge and history of the Communist Party of China (CPC) were published recently in the country. 
					
					The reader on the basic knowledge introduces the party's main theories, policies and knowledge about its idea, organization, work style, system, anti-corruption and integrity. 
					
					Another book deals with the great history, achievements and precious experience of the CPC.

articles.title: Public Security Education to Be Launched in Western China
articles.content:
Public Security Education to Be Launched in Western China
						

					Beijing, August 10 (KCNA) -- The Political Department of the Ministry of Public Security of China issued a notice calling for launching activities of public security education in the western part of the country.
					
					The activities are aimed to develop higher education in public security, improve the public security work and train personnel for this work in the western part.

articles.title: China Takes Measures to Prevent Illegal Deforestation
articles.content:
China Takes Measures to Prevent Illegal Deforestation
						

					Beijing, August 10 (KCNA) -- The State Forestry Administration of China has launched a special action for cracking down on illegal deforestation.
					
					The main targets of the special action are such practices as destroying forests, upturning hillside land for tillage, illegally owning woodland for construction and mining under the pretext of land development and rezoning.

articles.title: Beijing Makes Efforts to Improve Ecological Environment
articles.content:
Beijing Makes Efforts to Improve Ecological Environment
						

					Beijing, August 10 (KCNA) -- Trees were planted over 5 508 000 mu in Beijing over the past decade as part of efforts to improve ecological environment.
					
					The city created 659 000 mu of grass fields and improved 2 010 square km of rivers and streams.

articles.title: Russia Develops New Ballistic Missile
articles.content:
Russia Develops New Ballistic Missile
						

					Moscow, August 10 (KCNA) -- Russia is developing a new-type sea-launched intercontinental ballistic missile.
					
					The State Missile Centre announced that the missile is in the test stage and that it was launched successfully from the strategic nuclear missile submarine "Yekaterinburg" in May.

articles.title: Swine Flu Breaks out in Russia
articles.content:
Swine Flu Breaks out in Russia
						

					Moscow, August 10 (KCNA) -- Swine flu broke out in Krasnodar Territory, Russia.
					
					50 pigs were confirmed to have died of the swine flu in a district of the territory, said the Russian Ministry of Extraordinary Situation on August 7.
					
					The government declared the state of emergency and is taking emergency steps to prevent the disease from spreading.

articles.title: Moscow Mayor Warns of Extreme Acts during Election Campaign
articles.content:
Moscow Mayor Warns of Extreme Acts during Election Campaign
						

					Moscow, August 10 (KCNA) -- The Moscow mayor recently called on law enforcement agencies to disallow extreme acts and ethnic disputes during the campaign of the State Duma election to be held in December.     
					
					There may be a high political zeal, legal mass activities, rallies and demonstrations during the campaign, but they should not be allowed to lead to riot or violence, the mayor said.

articles.title: New Prime Minister Appointed in Thailand
articles.content:
New Prime Minister Appointed in Thailand
						

					Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- Thai King Bhumibol Adulyadej endorsed the appointment of Yingluck Shinawatra as Thailand's new prime minister on Monday.
					
					Yingluck, 44, was voted as the first woman prime minister in the country as she gained support of 296 MPs in a lower House meeting on Aug. 5.

articles.title: Iran Condemns West' Moves against Muslim
articles.content:
Iran Condemns West' Moves against Muslim
						

					Tehran, August 10 (KCNA) -- The Iranian minister of Culture in a diplomatic appearance on August 6 condemned the West for spreading the sentiment of hatred for Muslim.
					
					Disclosing the West's moves to stoke resentment at Muslim, he said that this kind of feelings for Muslim is prevalent in the West.
					
					He called upon all the Muslim countries to mobilize political and economic means and launch cultural activities to shatter the West's scheme.

articles.title: Iran Combats Drug Trafficking
articles.content:
Iran Combats Drug Trafficking
						

					Tehran, August 10 (KCNA) -- Iranian police successfully combated drug trafficking, confiscating some 8 685 kg of opium in Kerman Province.
					
					Since the beginning of the current Iranian year (March 20, 2011), the local police managed to discover and confiscate over 30 tons of various narcotic drugs in Kerman province, a news report said.

articles.title: Cambodia's Garment, Textile Raw Material Imports Up
articles.content:
Cambodia's Garment, Textile Raw Material Imports Up
						

					Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- Cambodia's garment and textile exports had increased by 45 percent in the first half of this year over the same period last year. This was made public by the Commerce Ministry on Saturday.

articles.title: Natural Disasters in Different Countries
articles.content:
Natural Disasters in Different Countries
						

					Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- Strong typhoon has swept different areas of China from August 4, causing damage.
					
					According to the State Disaster Reduction Committee, 1 353 000 were evacuated and many dwelling houses pulled down or damaged in Shanghai, Liaoning, Jiangsu, Zhejiang, Shandong provinces as of August 8.
					
					The number of the victims totals 3 649 800 and economic losses stand at 3.128 billion RMB.Y.
					
					The tropical storm, Nock-Ten, hit different areas of Thailand.
					
					The flood caused by the storm accompanied with heavy rains has left 20 people dead as of August 7.
					
					A total of 314 732 households of 1.03 million people have been affected by the widespread flood or mudslides. 
					
					A landslide struck east Malaysian state of Pahang on Sunday evening, leaving one dead, two badly injured and at least six still missing.

articles.title: Food Crisis in Kenya
articles.content:
Food Crisis in Kenya
						

					Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- Kenya is currently facing its worst drought in six decades, with over 3.5 million Kenyans, mainly in northern Kenya staring at imminent starvation and death.
					
					The government is taking emergency steps to soften the crisis.

articles.title: Japanese Maps Mark Tok Islets As Korean Territory
articles.content:
Japanese Maps Mark Tok Islets as Korean Territory
						

					Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- It is evidenced by maps drawn by Japan in the past that Tok Islets belong to Korea's territory. 
					
					Historically, Japan officially acknowledged Korea's dominium over Ullung Island and Tok Islets.
					
					A map is included in the book "Review of Three States", published by a map maker, Shihei Hayashi ((1738-1793), in around 1785.
					
					The map marks Korea in yellow color and Japan in green.
					
					It yellow-colors Ullung Island and Tok Islets on the East Sea of Korea, making it clear that they belong to Korea's territory.
					
					The same holds true for maps made by the Japanese military.
					
					The Ministry of Navy printed a "Korean east sea map" in 1876 on the basis of British and Russian vessels' survey results. The map puts Ullung Island and Tok Islets within the Korean territorial water.
					
					Afterwards, the Ministry of Navy re-printed the map several times, marking Tok Islets as Korea's territory until 1905.
					
					The Ministry of Army also included Ullung Island and Tok Islets in the Korean territory in its map printed in 1875 and the General Staff Office of the Ground Force did the same in its map drawn in 1936.
					
					Tok Islets were not marked as Japan's territory in the history map of a textbook for examination by the Ministry of Education and Culture in 1929 and 1933 and in another map printed in Japan in 1934.
					
					Although the Japanese imperialists put most of northeast Asia under their control at that time, they dared not to mark Tok Islets as Japanese territory.
					
					Korea's dominium over Tok Islets is undisputable in every aspect.

articles.title: Strike in U.S.
articles.content:
Strike in U.S.
						

					Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- Employees of Verizon communications Inc. staged a strike in the U.S. on August 7.
					
					About 45 000 workers attended.

articles.title: Funcionario militar rechaza nuevo complot anti-RPDC
articles.content:
Funcionario militar rechaza nuevo complot anti-RPDC
						

					Pyongyang, 11 de agosto (ACNC) -- Tras inventar de nuevo el complot de la "provocacion" cometida supuestamente por el Ejercito Popular de Corea en el mar cercano a la isla Yonphyong disparando los canones, los belicistas del circulo militar surcoreano libran ahora una feroz campana anti-Republica Popular Democratica de Corea movilizando los principales medios de prensa como KBS, MBC y Yonhap TV.
					
					En relacion con ese tema, el jefe de la delegacion de la parte Norte de las conversaciones de trabajo militar Norte-Sur de Corea dio el dia 10 la siguiente respuesta a la ACNC:
					
					En estos dias, se libra en todas partes de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea la marcha general para construir un Estado prospero.
					
					Tambien en la provincia de Hwanghae del Sur, cercana a las 5 islas del Mar Oeste, se impulsa en etapa crucial un gran proyecto de construccion para el mejoramiento de los niveles de la vida del pueblo.
					
					En el curso de esta obra, se llevo a cabo el dia 10 un dinamitazo de trabajo rutinario.
					
					Pero, asustados por esa explosion, los belicistas del circulo militar titere del Sur de Corea tergiversan la situacion como si el EPC hubiera cometido la "provocacion" de fuego artillero y pretextandola, procedieron a la bochornosa accion de respuesta militar.
					
					Es absurdo que en la actual era de ciencias en que funcionan sofisticados medios de deteccion e inteligencia, ellos hayan dado la voladura de trabajo por el canonazo y localizado el punto de impacto de proyectiles, que ni siquiera fueron tirados, como en las aguas maritimas perifericas de la "linea de limite al Norte".
					
					Ademas, resulta tragicomico que ellos hayan respondido con canonazos sin averiguar siquiera la verdad de lo ocurrido esta vez en el Mar Oeste de Corea, zona muy delicada donde frecuentan choques entre ambas partes coreanas.
					
					Para convertir ese incidente en la "provocacion" del EPC, el circulo militar surcoreano habla con bombo y platillo de su inmediato "ataque de respuesta" mintiendo que se escucho en el contorno de la isla Yonphyong del Mar Oeste la detonacion de tres proyectiles y uno de estos ha sobrepasado la "linea de limite al Norte". 
					
					Para dar credibilidad a su complot, los belicistas surcoreanos enviaron urgentemente los buques de combate de refuerzo al contorno de 5 islas del Mar Oeste, movilizaron los aviones de combate y decretaron el estado de alerta conjunta a las unidades en el frente.
					
					Al mismo tiempo, hicieron regresar todos los barcos pesqueros del Sur de Corea y evacuaron a los habitantes al refugio.
					
					El EPC no puede pasar por alto ese complot barato anti-RPDC que orquestaron otra vez a plena luz del dia los belicistas militares surcoreanos falsificando como canonazo la voladura normal de trabajo que se hace en el curso de construccion pacifica. 
					
					Este complot militar tiene su genesis en el vicio cronico de los conspiradores que insatisfechos con la invencion del incidente de hundimiento de la corbeta "Cheonan", el peor caso de la historia nacional utilizado para iniciar su campana en busca de enfrentamiento fratricida en general, degradaron la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana a la coyuntura de guerra, en que se intercambia el fuego, al provocar el incidente de fuego artillero en la isla Yonphyong.
					
					Igualmente, parte del siniestro intento de los belicistas del circulo militar surcoreano de romper el clima de dialogo, que se da ultimamente en la Peninsula Coreana y su contorno, y de llevar las relaciones intercoreanas a la fase de infarto caracterizada por los enfrentamientos y choques.
					
					Lo mas grave del caso es el malsano proposito de ellos de volver a poner tirante la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana al desplegar a toda costa los ejercicios militares conjuntos "Ulji Freedom Guardian" de este ano, pese al mensaje abierto de la RPDC enviado a nombre de la Representacion del Ejercito Popular de Corea en Phanmunjom, en que ella exigio a EE.UU. y las autoridades surcoreanas la suspension de esa maniobra.
					
					Especificamente, en el ambito interno, fomentan la atmosfera conflictiva con la RPDC inventando el "incidente del grupo de espias", el "de violacion de la ley de seguridad", el "de atentados de asesinato", etc. y por parte externa, pretenden procurar la justificacion de los mencionados ejercicios militares EE.UU.-Sur de Corea fabricando el incidente de canonazos.
					
					De esta manera, quieren buscar el pretexto de la guerra de agresion a la RPDC.
					
					Los que cayeron en crisis estan habituados a incurrir en los complots y falsificaciones.
					
					A traves del presente caso, quedo evidenciado una vez mas que las autoridades surcoreanas, en particular, los belicistas militares son grandes maestros en tejer complots e inventar, capaces de cualquier cosa para enfrentarse con la connacional RPDC.
					
					Los criminales seran condenados severamente por todos los coreanos.
					
					El ejercito y el pueblo de la RPDC seguiran marchando adelante hacia el mejoramiento de las relaciones intercoreanas, la paz y la reunificacion de la nacion frustrando con audacia los complots de toda indole de los elementos conflictivos anti-RPDC.

articles.title: Desmienten en China rumores inventados por medios japoneses

Desmienten en China rumores inventados por medios japoneses
						

					Beijing, 10 de agosto (ACNC) -- El dia 7, los medios de comunicacion masiva de Japon como Tokio Shimbun reportaron que China ha rechazado la propuesta de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea de realizar ejercicios militares conjuntos. Se hacen ecos de esa version erronea los medios de prensa del Sur de Corea como Dong-A Ilbo.
					
					En entrevista concedida el dia 9 al periodico chino Huan Qiu Shibao, el Departamento de Prensa del Ministerio de Defensa de China dejo en claro que ese tema "no fue mencionado nunca en la prensa".

					Anteriormente, ellos habian divulgado la informacion no apegada a la realidad de que el Ejercito Popular de Liberacion de China esta estacionado en Corea.
					
					En los ultimos anos, Japon no repara en exacerbar la ya tensa situacion del Noreste Asiatico, que esta en un periodo delicado de cambios, a traves de diversos medios para preparar el pretexto de fortalecimiento de la alianza militar Japon-EE.UU.

articles.title: Mapas japoneses reconocen la soberania de Corea sobre islote Tok
articles.content:
Mapas japoneses reconocen la soberania de Corea sobre islote Tok
						

					Pyongyang, 11 de agosto (ACNC) -- Historicamente, Japon sabia bien que la isla Ullung y el islote Tok son territorios coreanos, en particular, habia reconocido oficialmente en varias ocasiones la soberania de Corea sobre el segundo.
					
					El elaborador de atlas de Japon Shihei Hayashi (1738-1793) edito a eso de 1785 el libro intitulado "Revista de tres Estados".
					
					Para distinguir las fronteras y el territorio, el mapa senalaba a Corea en color amarillo y a Japon, en el verde.
					
					El marco la isla Ullung y el islote Tok en sus posiciones correctas y los pinto en amarillo dejando en claro que forman parte del territorio coreano.
					
					Sucedia lo mismo en los mapas hechos por el circulo militar de Japon.
					
					El Ministerio de Fuerzas Navales de Japon redacto en 1876 en base a los datos recogidos por los barcos de Gran Bretana y Rusia el "Mapa del Mar Este de Corea" incluyendo en este mar los mencionados islotes.
					
					Todas las ediciones del mismo mapa publicadas hasta el ano 1905 anotaron el islote Tok como territorio coreano.
					
					El Ministerio de Fuerzas Terrestres tambien incluyo la isla Ullung y el islote Tok al territorio coreano en su mapa publicado en 1875.
					
					Hasta el Cuartel General del Estado Mayor de Fuerzas Terrestres de Japon hizo lo mismo en su mapa de 1936.
					
					El mapa de historia de Japon insertado en el manual examinado por el Ministerio de Educacion en 1929 y 1933 y el otro atlas publicado en 1934 no incluian tampoco el islote Tok al territorio japones, aunque los imperialistas japoneses estaban entonces en condiciones de manipular a sus caprichos el mapa del Nordeste Asiatico.
